Problem:
Consider a function \\( z(t) = e^{At}v \\) where A is a matrix and v is a complex constant vector. The system is then subjected to a Fourier transformation defined by \\( F(z)(\\omega) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} e^{-i\omega t} z(t) \, dt \\).

If a transformation \\( G(z) = e^{Ct}z(t) \\) (where C is another matrix) is imposed at time \\( t_1 \\), will this intervention leave the Fourier transform \\( F(z)(\\omega) \\) at any frequency \\( \\omega \\) unaffected for all times t > t_1?
Explanation: The intervention \\( e^{Ct} \\) modifies the function \\( z(t) \\) by an additional exponential factor related to the matrix C, impacting how \\( z(t) \\) evolves past \\( t_1 \\) and thus altering the outcome of \\( F(z)(\\omega) \\). The frequency domain representation will reflect these changes, showing dependencies on both A and C.
